```{r}

# Load libraries for datahandling
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(reshape2)
library(data.table)

#############################################
## Prepare data
#############################################

# Read in data and filter for selected countries
data <- read.csv('GDP_WB_Asia_Data.csv',sep=',', header = T)# GDP data
countries <- c("KHM","CHN","HKG","IDN","JPN","KOR","LAO","MMR","PHL","SGP","THA","VNM","MYS","WLD","ARB","CSS","CEB","CAF","CHI","EAS","EAP","ECS","LCN","MEA","NAC","OSS","PSS","SAS") # Missing Malaysia
data_filtered <- data[data$Country.Code %in% countries ,]


# Widen datasets
data_tidy <- tidyr::gather(data_filtered, 'Year','Number',5:25)

# Set column names
colnames(data_tidy) <- c("Country","Country_code","Series","Series_code","Year","Value")

# Set year to four digits
data_tidy$Year <- substr(data_tidy$Year, 2, 5)

# Remove all null values
data_tidy$Value[data_tidy$Value == ".."] <- "0"

# Fold out 
data_tidy_spreadout <- dcast(data_tidy, Country+Year~Series_code)

# Name all data fields
colnames(data_tidy_spreadout) <- c("Country","Year","FDI","ElectricityAccess","ElectricPowerConsumption","BankNonperformingLoans","BankCapitaltoAssetsRatio","BorrowersCommercialBank","DomesticCredittoPrivateSector","BankLiquidReservestoBankAssetsRatio","EaseofBusiness","ExportGoodsServices", "AgraTotalValueAdded","ServiceValueAdded","IndustryValueAdded","AdjustedNetNationalIncome","GDPPerCapita","GDPPerCapitaPP","AdultLiteracy","Gini","EmployAgriculture","EmployIndustry","EmployService","Unemployment","DeathRate","Population")
data_tidy_spreadout.df <- as.data.frame(data_tidy_spreadout)


#############################################
# Create file for Plot 1 - GDP development 
#############################################
plot1_selection <- data_tidy_spreadout.df[,c("Year","Country","GDPPerCapita")]
plot1_tidyed <- tidyr::gather(plot1_selection, 'Series','Number',3:3)
selected1_years <- c(1960,1965,1970,1975,1980,1985,1990,1995,2000,2005,2010,2015) # Due to most populated period of production numbers
plot1_tidyed_filtered <- plot1_tidyed[plot1_tidyed$Year %in% selected1_years ,]

selected1 <- c("World","Caribbean small states","Central Europe and the Baltics","East Asia & Pacific","Europe & Central Asia","Latin America & Caribbean","Middle East & North Africa","North America","South Asia") # Due to most populated period of production numbers
'%!in%' <- Negate("%in%")
plot1_tidyed_filtered2 <- plot1_tidyed_filtered[plot1_tidyed_filtered$Country %in% selected1 ,]


write.csv(plot1_tidyed_filtered2, file ="1_GDP_development.csv")

#############################################
# Create file for Plot 2 - Zoom in - add Population
#############################################
plot2_selection <- data_tidy_spreadout.df[,c("Year","Country","GDPPerCapita","ExportGoodsServices","Population")]
selected2_years <- c(1970,1975,1980,1985,1990,1995,2000,2005,2010,2015) # Due to most populated period of production numbers
plot2_tidyed_filtered <- plot2_selection[plot2_selection$Year %in% selected2_years ,]

selected2 <- c("Vietnam", "Malaysia", "China", "Hong Kong SAR, China","Indonesia","Singapore","Laos PDR","Cambodia","Thailand","Myanmar") # Due to most populated period of production numbers
'%!in%' <- Negate("%in%")
plot2_tidyed_filtered2 <- plot2_tidyed_filtered[plot2_tidyed_filtered$Country %in% selected2 ,]


write.csv(plot2_tidyed_filtered2, file ="2_gdp_animated.csv")

#############################################
# Creating file for Plot 3 - Economic Sectors
#############################################
plot3_selection <- data_tidy_spreadout.df[,c("Year","Country","EmployAgriculture","EmployIndustry","EmployService","GDPPerCapita")]

# Remove rows with no values
###data_tidy$Number[data_tidy$Number == ".."] <- "0"..### fix

plot3_tidyed <- tidyr::gather(plot3_selection, 'Series','Production',3:6)
selected3_years <- c(2010) # Due to most populated period of production numbers
plot3_tidyed_filtered <- plot3_tidyed[plot3_tidyed$Year %in% selected3_years ,]

selected3_countries <- c("Myanmar","Vietnam") # Due to most populated period of production numbers
'%!in%' <- Negate("%in%")
plot3_tidyed_filtered2 <- plot3_tidyed_filtered[plot3_tidyed_filtered$Country %!in% selected3_countries ,]

write.csv(plot3_tidyed_filtered2, file ="3_Economic_sectors.csv")

#############################################
# Creating file for Plot 4 - Economic Sectors continued
#############################################
plot4_selection <- data_tidy_spreadout.df[,c("Year","Country","EmployAgriculture","EmployIndustry","EmployService")]
plot4_tidyed <- tidyr::gather(plot4_selection, 'Series','Production',3:5)
selected4_years <- c(1980,1985,1990,1995,2000,2005,2010) # Due to most populated period of production numbers
plot4_tidyed_filtered <- plot4_tidyed[plot4_tidyed$Year %in% selected4_years ,]
selected4_countries <- c("Myanmar","China","Singapore","Thailand","Vietnam","Cambodia", "Lao PDR") # Due to most populated period of production numbers
'%!in%' <- Negate("%in%")
plot4_tidyed_filtered2 <- plot4_tidyed_filtered[plot4_tidyed_filtered$Country %!in% selected4_countries ,]
write.csv(plot4_tidyed_filtered2, file ="4_Economic_sectors_cont.csv")

#############################################
# Creating file for Plot 5 - Finance
#############################################
plot5_selection <- data_tidy_spreadout.df[,c("Year","Country","GDPPerCapita","DeathRate","ElectricPowerConsumption","Unemployment","Population","Gini","EaseofBusiness","ExportGoodsServices","FDI")]
plot5_tidyed <- tidyr::gather(plot5_selection, 'Series','Production',4:7)

selected5_years <- c(2000,2001,2002,2003,2004,2005,2006,2007,2008,2009,2010,2011,2012,2013) # Due to most populated period of production numbers
plot5_tidyed_filtered <- plot5_tidyed[plot5_tidyed$Year %in% selected5_years ,]

selected5_countries <- c("Indonesia", "Philippines","Laos PDR","Vietnam","Cambodia") # Due to most populated period of production numbers
plot5_tidyed_filtered2 <- plot5_tidyed_filtered[plot5_tidyed_filtered$Country %in% selected5_countries ,]

plot5_tidyed_filtered3 <- plot5_tidyed_filtered2[plot5_tidyed_filtered2$Production != 0 ,]

write.csv(plot5_tidyed_filtered3, file ="5_banking.csv")

#c("Country","Year","FDI","ElectricityAccess","ElectricPowerConsumption","BankNonperformingLoans","BankCapitaltoAssetsRatio","BorrowersCommercialBank","DomesticCredittoPrivateSector","BankLiquidReservestoBankAssetsRatio","EaseofBusiness","ExportGoodsServices", "AgraTotalValueAdded","ServiceValueAdded","IndustryValueAdded","AdjustedNetNationalIncome","GDPPerCapita","GDPPerCapitaPP","AdultLiteracy","Gini","EmployAgriculture","EmployIndustry","EmployService","Unemployment","DeathRate","Population")
```
